result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 3:54 pm 
INCLUDES 15CF1149 AND 15CM2275. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig for Desiree Toldt; Def appears in person with Atty Dan Cveykus.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to file amended information in 15CF1149. 
COURT grants. Amended Information filed in 15CF1149. 

State moves to: 
In 15CM2275: Ct. 1 (OAR)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 15CF1149: Ct. 1 (Misd. Theft)>>NO CONTEST. 
                      : Ct. 2 (Misd. Theft)>>NO CONTEST. 
                      : Ct. 3 (Misd. Theft)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & defers entry of judgment. 

COURT ORDERS: In 15CF1149: Cts. 1 -3>>DEOJ for 18 to 24 months with conditions as outlined in written agreement. 
State notes if def successfully completes agreement. Judgment will be entered on Ct. 1 with costs and Cts. 2 & 3 will be dismissed. 
Review of DEOJ set for April 12, 2018 at 1:10 pm. 

Adj: 4:02 pm

Clerk Becky.

Bond:  Continued
Adj: 3:19 pm

INCLUDES 15CF1149 & 15CM2275 Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license. Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 ON/OR before PTC. Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.   No contact with J.M. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
